ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Taunt Macro
ygData.msgSnippet: I use it to sound cool and powerful.  Back when you could charm in PvP I would spam it to really rub it in.  Then pet follow me levitate myself and proceed to
ygData.messageBody:
I use it to sound cool and powerful. Back when you could charm in PvP I
would spam it to really rub it in. Then pet follow me levitate myself and
proceed to run over really tall mountains or in lava. Hehe, Only did this
to jerks mind you.

Mu

-----Original Message-----
From: alexander.jones@...
[mailto:alexander.jones@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 09, 2001 1:10 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Taunt Macro


its - A Fire_Giant_Warrior00 says, "My Leader is xyz" - And its been out
maybe since long before i hit my first charm song (29 i think) , hmm maybe a
year or so. I use it to inform my group which target is charmed if the
situation needs charm.

/Alex

-----Original Message-----
From: Nygaard, Jeff [mailto:jnygaard@...]
Sent: den 8 maj 2001 20:37
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Taunt Macro


Yea, I have seen that web site before. One command I'm not sure I've seen
before is:

/pet who the leader - pet says who commands it (useful for enchanters to
quickly notify their party that said creature is now a pet).

I've never seen "a Fire Giant says Teenimu is my leader" or anything like
that. What exactly does the phrase look like?

How long has this one been out.

Jeff


-----Original Message-----
From: Cook Miller-ETOP03 [SMTP:etop03@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 08, 2001 12:01 PM
To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: [EverQuest] Taunt Macro

I do not have a warrior, but I do have a bard that I made a track
macro for and it should be a similar process. I think Taunt falls under the
category of a doability. Here is a definition from a website I use:

/doability # - Causes player to perform the special ability
specified by number. For example, if Lay On Hands if your characters 4th
ability (1-6 are the 6 general abilities, while 7-10 are the 4 combat
abilities besides Melee and Ranged.), /doability 4 would perform the Lay on
Hands.

So, a taunt macro could go like this:

/g Taunting %t onto me
/doability 7(or whatever number it ends up being)


The /g tells your group what you are doing. The /doability #
performs the taunt. It should work. Good luck.

BTW, here is a site one of my bard friends Tallies keeps up that has
lots of good information:

http://amtgard.pinkpig.com/everquest/eqcommands.htm

Watch out for word wrap when you click the link.

Robiinton Masterhealer
Piemur Draggonsinger
